meanings.definition: To put someone or something in the place of another.
meanings.sent1: I will replace the broken toy with a new one.
meanings.sent2: When the light bulb burns out, you need to replace it.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to replace the dog as the king of the house.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could easily replace the sun on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: In the game of chess, the pawn can replace the queen if played strategically.

meanings.definition: To take the place of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The substitute teacher will replace Mrs. Smith for the day.
meanings.sent2: When the lead actor got sick, they had to replace him with a new one.
meanings.sent3: The robot thought it could replace the human workers, but it was mistaken.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed could easily replace any lack of talent.
meanings.sent5: The new technology will soon replace the old methods in this industry.

meanings.definition: To provide a substitute or alternative for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I will replace sugar with honey in this recipe.
meanings.sent2: When the store ran out of my favorite brand, I had to replace it with a different one.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to replace his red nose with a blue one, but it just wasn't the same.
meanings.sent4: Laughter can replace sadness like sunshine after a storm.
meanings.sent5: Her creativity knows no bounds; she can replace any ingredient with a creative twist.
